content: We live about 20 minutes from Mineral Wells and we made sure we were there 8 am. This is a video of Dana Bowman. He was a Special Forces soldier and a member of the U.S. Army's elite parachute team. The Golden Knights in 1994, a mid-air collision cost him both of his legs. Dana's determination in the Army, and now in the civilian world, has earned him woldwide recognition as a motivational speaker and skydiver demonstrator. I have over 30 pix, trying to get them on here too. It will take me a while, lol. Joseph L. Galloway, author of "We Were Soldiers Once... and Young" was there and Dennis got his autograph. It was a bitter/sweet day for all the Vietnam Vets. 'http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JpLbtT88By8 This message has been edited. Last edited by: RetiredMarineWife, Mon 01 June 2009 10:29 AM
reply: We live about 20 minutes from Mineral Wells and we made sure we were there 8 am. This is a video of Dana Bowman. content: Dennis and I went down there the week before, reasons, all you Vietnam Vets will know why. Anyway, here are some pix I took. Dennis has been in DC many times, but he could never walk up to the Wall. This Memorial is being built from donations only, it is not completed. If I can get permission from the Mods, I will give the info on here. In the little pix, Dennis on the right, Charlie on his right...

content: RMF, since you're so close, when they get it finished, you should check out the Van Zandt County Veteran's Memorial... it's going to be beautiful. <<http://www.vzcm.org/index.html>>> I'm so glad that these small towns are honoring our Veterans as well. Makes me proud.

content: Joe Galloway speaking. He spoke for almost 30 or more minutes. And I must say, I enjoyed everyword and I cried... Dana Bowman Dennis hugged a South Vietnamese Soldier Joe Galloway signing Dennis' book Dennis introducing himself to Joe Galloway
